CreateMyBase.summary: 创建专属集群（包含主机信息，附加服务信息）

400.errorMessage: The parameter is invalid.
Invalid component.
The account password format is invalid.
No host is available for the requested instance.

CreateMyBase.title: CreateMyBase

DescribeRegions.title: DescribeRegions
DescribeRegions.summary: Queries the most recent region list.
DescribeRegions.description: For more information about region IDs, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).

schema.description: The region ID. For more information, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).

The database engine of the dedicated cluster. Valid values:

*   **MySQL**
*   **SQL Server**

The CPU overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster.

>  Unit: %. Valid values: **100** to **300**. Default value: **200**, which specifies that the total amount of CPU resources allocated to all instances is twice the amount of actual CPU resources. This helps you maximize CPU utilization.

The maximum memory usage of each host in the dedicated cluster.

>  Unit: %. Valid values: **0** to **100**. Default value: **100**.

The storage overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster.

>  Unit: %. Valid values: **100** to **300**. Default value: **200**, which specifies that the total amount of storage resources allocated to all instances is twice the amount of actual storage resources. This helps you maximize storage usage. This parameter does not take effect for dedicated clusters that run SQL Server.

The policy that is used to allocate resources in the dedicated cluster. Valid values:

*   **Evenly** (default): The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts where no resources or fewer resources are allocated. This maximizes system stability.
*   **Intensively**: The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts that are created earlier and have more allocated resources. This maximizes resource utilization.
The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) where you want to create the dedicated cluster. You can log on to the VPC console and click **VPCs** in the left-side navigation pane to view the VPC ID.

The policy that is used to handle host failures. Valid values:

*   **Auto** (default): The system automatically replaces faulty hosts.
*   **Manual**: You must manually replace faulty hosts.

>  When you create a dedicated cluster that runs **MySQL**, you can select a policy based on your business requirements. For dedicated clusters that run other database engines, the default value **Auto** is used.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

Specifies whether to grant the host OS permissions. Valid values:

*   **0**: no.
*   **1**: yes.

>  When you create a dedicated cluster that runs **MySQL or SQL Server**, you can grant the host OS permissions based on your business requirements. For dedicated clusters that run other database engines, the default value **0** is used. When you create an ApsaraDB MyBase for SQL Server dedicated cluster, you must set this parameter to 1.
The name of the dedicated cluster. The name must be 1 to 64 characters in length and can contain letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-). The name must start with a letter.

403.errorMessage: You are not authorized to perform this action.

404.errorMessage: Key account cluster is not supported for the region.

schema.description: The dedicated cluster ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the Dedicated Clusters page to view the dedicated cluster ID.
The region ID of the dedicated cluster. For more information, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).

400.errorMessage: There are hosts in usercluster, can't delete it.
The cluster contains an instance and cannot be deleted.

DeleteDedicatedHostGroup.title: DeleteDedicatedHostGroup
DeleteDedicatedHostGroup.description: You can call this operation to delete a dedicated cluster only after all the instances and hosts in the dedicated cluster are deleted.

schema.description: The region ID of the dedicated cluster. For more information, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).

The dedicated cluster ID.

>  You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the Dedicated Clusters page to view the dedicated cluster ID.
The name of the dedicated cluster.

The CPU overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster. Valid values: **100** to **300**.

>  If you change the CPU overcommit ratio to **300%**, the total CPU resources of all instances are three times the actual CPU resources. This maximizes the use of CPU resources.
The maximum memory usage of each host in the dedicated cluster. Valid values: **0** to **100**.
The storage overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster. Valid values: **100** to **200**.

The policy that is used to allocate resources in the dedicated cluster. Valid values:

*   **Evenly**: The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts where no resources or fewer resources are allocated. This maximizes system stability.
*   **Intensively**: The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts that are created earlier and have more allocated resources. This maximizes resource utilization.

The policy that is used to handle host failures. Valid values:

*   **Auto**: The system automatically replaces faulty hosts.
*   **Manual**: You must manually replace faulty hosts.

>  You can select a policy based on your business requirements only for dedicated clusters that run **MySQL**. For dedicated clusters that run other database engines, the default value Auto is used.

Specifies whether to grant the host OS permissions. Valid values:

*   **0**: no.
*   **1**: yes.

>  You can grant the host OS permissions based on your business requirements only when you create dedicated clusters that run **MySQL, SQL Server, or PostgreSQL**. For dedicated clusters that run other database engines, the default value 0 is used.

400.errorMessage: The userid have no permission.

403.errorMessage: User not authorized to operate on the specified resource, or this API does not support RAM.

ModifyDedicatedHostGroupAttribute.title: ModifyDedicatedHostGroupAttribute
ModifyDedicatedHostGroupAttribute.summary: Modifies configurations such as the CPU overcommit ratio, memory usage, storage overcommit ratio, and resource allocation policy for a dedicated cluster.
ModifyDedicatedHostGroupAttribute.description: For more information, see [Manage dedicated clusters](~~182328~~).

schema.description: The region ID. For more information, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).

The dedicated cluster ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the Dedicated Clusters page to view the dedicated cluster ID.

*   If you leave this parameter empty, the information about all hosts within the region is returned.
*   If you specify a dedicated cluster ID, the information about all hosts in the dedicated cluster within the region is returned.

The image of the host. Valid values:

*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntAlwaysonLicense**: SQL

Server Cluster Edition.

*   **WindowsWithMssqlStdLicense**: SQL

Server Standard Edition.

*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntLicense**: SQL

Server Enterprise Edition.

*   **WindowsWithMssqlWebLicense**: SQL

Server Web Edition.

*   **AliLinux**: other images.

The database engine used to filter hosts. Valid values:

*   MySQL
*   SQL Server
*   PosgreSQL

*   Redis

DiskAllocateRation.description: The disk allocation rate of the host.

DeployType.description: The instance deployment mode of the host.

CreateTime.description: The time when the host was created.

DedicatedHostCountGroupByHostType.description: The number of hosts by storage type.

DedicatedHostGroupId.description: The ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

DiskUtility.description: The disk usage of the host.

MemAllocatedAmount.description: The amount of memory allocated to the host.

CpuAllocationRatio.description: The CPU overcommit ratio of the host.

MemAllocationRatio.description: The memory overcommit ratio of the host.

MemAllocateRation.description: The memory allocation ratio of the host.

CpuAllocatedAmount.description: The number of CPU cores allocated to the host.

DedicatedHostGroupDesc.description: The name of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

CpuAllocateRation.description: The CPU allocation ratio of the host.

InstanceNumber.description: The number of instances deployed on the host.

OpenPermission.description:
Indicates whether the host OS permissions are granted. Valid values:

*   **0 or 1**: no.
*   **2 or 3** (default): yes.

>  When you create a dedicated cluster that runs **MySQL**, **SQL Server**, or **PostgreSQL**, you can grant the host OS permissions based on your business requirements.

VPCId.description: The virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

DiskAllocatedAmount.description: The disk storage allocated to the host.

DiskUsedAmount.description: The disk storage used by the host.

AllocationPolicy.description:
The policy that is used to allocate host resources. Valid values:

*   **Evenly**: The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts where no resources or fewer resources are allocated. This maximizes system stability.
*   **Intensively**: The system preferentially deploys database instances on the hosts that are created earlier and have more allocated resources. This maximizes resource utilization.

Engine.description: The database engine of the host.

DiskAllocationRatio.description: The storage overcommit ratio of the host.

BastionInstanceId.description: The ID of the primary instance deployed on the host. If no primary instance is deployed on the host, an empty string is returned.

HostReplacePolicy.description:
The policy that is used for host troubleshooting. Valid values:

*   Auto (default): The system automatically replaces faulty hosts.
*   Manual: You must manually replace faulty hosts.

items.description: The zones where the hosts are created.

403.errorMessage: You are not authorized to perform this action.

DescribeDedicatedHostGroups.title: DescribeDedicatedHostGroups
DescribeDedicatedHostGroups.summary: Queries the information about hosts in dedicated clusters.

schema.description:
The dedicated cluster ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Dedicated Clusters** page to view the dedicated cluster ID.

>  The database engine of the host is the same as the database engine of the cluster.
The instance type of the host. For information about the host instance types supported by different database engines, see [Instance types of hosts](~~206343~~).
The billing method of the host. Set the value to **prepaid**.

The unit of the subscription duration. Valid values:

*   **Year**
*   **Month**

The subscription duration of the host.

*   Valid values when **Period** is set to **Year**: **1** to **5**.****
*   Valid values when **Period** is set to **Month**: **1** to **9**.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

Specifies whether to enable the auto-renewal feature. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

>  If you do not specify this parameter, the default value **false** is used.

The image of the host. Valid values:

*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntAlwaysonLicense**: SQL Server Cluster Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlStdLicense**: SQL Server Standard Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntLicense**: SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlWebLicense**: SQL Server Web Edition.
*   **AliLinux**: other images.

>  When you create a host that runs SQL Server, you must specify a host image.

The password of the host. You can specify a password only when you create a host in a **Proprietary MyBase** dedicated cluster.

*   The password must be 8 to 30 characters in length.
*   The password must contain at least three of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.
*   The password can contain the following special characters: () \ \` ~ ! @ # $ % ^ & \* - \_ + = | { } \[ ] : ; ' < > , . ? /

The disk type of the host. This parameter takes effect only for dedicated clusters that run Tair. Valid values:

*   **cloud_essd**: PL1 enhanced SSD (ESSD).
*   **cloud_essd0**: PL0 ESSD.

The disk storage of the host. This parameter takes effect only for dedicated clusters that run Tair. Unit: GB. Valid values:

*   512
*   1024
*   1536
*   2048
*   2560
*   3072
*   3584
*   4096
The [region ID](~~198326~~) of the dedicated cluster.
The zone ID. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~214103~~) operation to query the most recent zone list.
The vSwitch ID. You can view the vSwitch ID in the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) console.
The deployment type of the Self-managed MyBase cluster. Valid values: onACK and onECS.
The alias of the Self-managed MyBase cluster.
The VPC ID of the Self-managed MyBase cluster.
The services associated with the instances in the Self-managed MyBase on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) cluster.

items.description: The services associated with the instances in the Self-managed MyBase on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) cluster.

schema.description: The parameters of the instances in the Self-managed MyBase on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) cluster.

ChargeType.description:
The billing method. Valid values:

*   PrePaid: subscription.
*   PostPaid: pay-as-you-go.

Amount.description: The number of hosts that you want to create.

Period.description: The subscription duration of the host. The Period parameter must be specified when ChargeType is set to PrePaid.

PeriodType.description: The unit of the subscription duration. Default value: Month.

SystemDiskSize.description: The size of the system disk. Unit: GB.

SystemDiskCategory.description: The type of the system disk.

DataDiskSize.description: The size of the data disk. Unit: GB.

DataDiskCategory.description: The type of the data disk.

AutoRenew.description: Specifies whether to enable auto-renewal for the host. Default value: false.

KeyPairName.description: The name of the key pair.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The IDs of the security groups to which the instance belongs.

items.description: The IDs of the security groups to which the instance belongs.

Tags.description: The tags that you want to add to the host.

items.description: The tags that you want to add to the host.

InternetMaxBandwidthOut.description:
The maximum outbound public bandwidth. Unit: Mbit/s.

Default value: 0. If you specify the parameter to a value greater than 0, a public IP address is automatically created.

InternetChargeType.description:
The metering method for network usage. Valid values:

*   PayByBandwidth
*   PayByTraffic

DedicatedHostId.description: The ID of the created host.

400.errorMessage: The parameter is invalid.
Invalid component.
The account password format is invalid.
No host is available for the requested instance.

CreateDedicatedHost.title: CreateDedicatedHost
CreateDedicatedHost.summary: Creates hosts in a dedicated cluster.

schema.description: [The region ID](~~198326~~).
The dedicated cluster ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Dedicated Clusters** page to view the dedicated cluster ID.
The order ID. You can log on to the Billing Management console and go to the **Orders** page to view the order ID.

The storage type of the host. Valid values:

*   **dhg_local_ssd**: local SSD.
*   **dhg_cloud_ssd** or **dhg_cloud_essd**: enhanced SSD (ESSD).

The state of the host. Valid values:

*   **0**: The host is being created.
*   **1**: The host is running.
*   **2**: The host is faulty.
*   **3**: The host is ready for disabling.
*   **4**: The host is being maintained.
*   **5**: The host is disabled.
*   **6**: The host is restarting.
*   **7**: The host is locked.

>  When a host fails, the host is disabled. Before the host is disabled, the data of the instances that run on the host is migrated to another host.

Specifies whether instances can be deployed on the host. Valid values:

*   **Allocatable**: Instances can be deployed on the host.
*   **Suspended**: Instances cannot be deployed on the host.
The zone ID. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~214103~~) operation to query the most recent zone list.
The ID of the host in the dedicated cluster. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.
The page number.
The number of entries per page.

The tags that are added to the host. Each tag is a key-value pair that consists of TagKey and TagValue. You can specify a maximum of five tags in the following format for each request: {"key1":"value1","key2":"value2"...}.

>  If you want to filter hosts based on tags, do not specify the **DedicatedHostId** parameter. Otherwise, the **DedicatedHostId** parameter is used to filter hosts.

TotalRecords.description: The total number of entries returned.

PageSize.description: The number of entries per page.

HostType.description: The storage type of the host.

HostStorage.description: The total storage of the host. Unit: GB.

MemoryUsed.description: The amount of memory used by the host. Unit: GB.

DedicatedHostGroupId.description: The ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

AllocationStatus.description:
Specifies whether instances can be deployed on the host. Valid values:

*   **Allocatable**: Instances can be deployed on the host.
*   **Suspended**: Instances cannot be deployed on the host.

StorageUsed.description: The amount of storage used by the host. Unit: GB.

EcsClassCode.description: The instance type of the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. For more information, see [Overview of instance families](~~25378~~).

MemAllocationRatio.description: The memory usage of the host. Unit: %.

CreatedTime.description: The time when the host was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the **yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ** format. The time is displayed in UTC.

IPAddress.description: The IP address of the host.

HostStatus.description:
The state of the host. Valid values:

*   **0**: The host is being created.
*   **1**: The host is running.
*   **2**: The host is faulty.
*   **3**: The host is ready for disabling.
*   **4**: The host is being maintained.
*   **5**: The host is disabled.
*   **6**: The host is restarting.
*   **7**: The host is locked.

>  When a host fails, the host is disabled. Before the host is disabled, the data of the instances that run on the host is migrated to another host.

HostCPU.description: The number of CPU cores of the host.

CpuUsed.description: The number of used CPU cores.

InstanceNumber.description: The number of instances deployed on the host.

OpenPermission.description:
Indicates whether the host OS permissions are granted. Valid values:

*   **0**: no.
*   **1** (default): yes.

DistributionSymbol.description:
The distribution symbol of the host.

>  This parameter is returned only when the host runs **Tair**.

VPCId.description: The virtual private cloud (VPC) ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

HostClass.description: The instance type of the host.

EndTime.description: The expiration time of the host. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the **yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ** format. The time is displayed in UTC.

VSwitchId.description: The ID of the vSwitch to which the host is connected.

ZoneId.description: The ID of the zone in which the host resides.

CPUAllocationRatio.description: The CPU utilization of the host.

ImageCategory.description: The image type of the host.

Engine.description: The database engine of the host.

DiskAllocationRatio.description: The disk usage of the host. Unit: %.

HostMem.description: The memory size of the host. Unit: GB.

BastionInstanceId.description: The ID of the bastion host with which the host is associated.

AccountName.description:
The custom account name of the host.

*   The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, and underscores (\_).
*   The name must start with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or a digit.
*   The name must be 2 to 16 characters in length.

AccountType.description:
The account type of the host. Valid values:

**Normal**: standard account.

**Admin**: administrator account.

DistributionTag.description: The distribution tag of the host.

Category.description:
The type of the dedicated cluster. Valid values:

*   **Pro**: Proprietary MyBase.
*   **Standard**: Managed MyBase.

>  This parameter is returned only for the China site (aliyun.com).

EcsId.description:
The ID of the ECS instance.

>  This parameter is returned only for the China site (aliyun.com) when the dedicated cluster is of the **Proprietary MyBase** type.

DiskInfo.description:
The disk information of the ECS instance.

>  This parameter is returned only for the China site (aliyun.com) when the dedicated cluster is of the **Proprietary MyBase** type.

MssqlSupportVersion.description: The versions supported by hosts in ApsaraDB MyBase for SQL Server.

MaxAutoScaleHostStorage.description: The maximum storage of local SSDs for auto scaling. Unit: GB.

400.errorMessage: tags parameter is invalid
The userid have no permission.

403.errorMessage: User not authorized to operate on the specified resource, or this API does not support RAM.

DescribeDedicatedHosts.title: DescribeDedicatedHosts
DescribeDedicatedHosts.summary: Queries the information about hosts in a dedicated cluster.
DescribeDedicatedHosts.description: After hosts are created in a dedicated cluster, you can query the information about the hosts such as performance metrics, total number of CPU cores, total memory size, and total storage.

schema.description: [The region ID](~~198326~~).
The host ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.
The ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Dedicated Clusters** page to view the dedicated cluster ID.

HostType.description:
The storage type of the host. Valid values:

*   **dhg_cloud_ssd** or **dhg_cloud_essd**: enhanced SSD (ESSD).
*   **dhg_local_ssd**: local SSD.

HostStorage.description: The total storage of the host. Unit: GB.

InstanceNumberROSlave.description: The number of secondary instances of the read-only instance deployed on the host.

AccountType.description:
The account type of the host. Valid values:

*   **Normal**: standard account.
*   **Admin**: administrator account.

MemoryUsed.description: The amount of memory used by the host. Unit: GB.

DedicatedHostGroupId.description: The ID of the dedicated cluster in which the host is created.

InstanceNumberROMaster.description: The number of primary instances of the read-only instance deployed on the host.

AllocationStatus.description:
Indicates whether instances can be deployed on the host. Valid values:

*   **Allocatable**: yes.
*   **Suspended**: no.

StorageUsed.description: The storage usage of the host. Unit: GB.

EcsClassCode.description: The instance type of the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

MemAllocationRatio.description: The memory usage of the host. Unit: %.

CreatedTime.description: The time when the host was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the **yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ** format. The time is displayed in UTC.

IPAddress.description: The IP address of the host.

AutoRenew.description:
Indicates whether auto-renewal is enabled on the host. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false** (default)

HostStatus.description:
The state of the host. Valid values:

*   **0**: The host is being created.
*   **1**: The host is running.
*   **2**: The host is faulty.
*   **3**: The host is ready for disabling.
*   **4**: The host is being maintained.
*   **5**: The host is disabled.
*   **6**: The host is restarting.
*   **7**: The host is locked.

>  When a host fails, the host is disabled. Before the host is disabled, the data of the instances that run on the host is migrated to another host. This ensures data integrity.

HostCPU.description: The number of CPU cores of the host.

OpenPermission.description:
Indicates whether the host OS permissions are grated. Valid values:

*   **0**: no.
*   **1**: yes.

InstanceNumber.description: The number of instances deployed on the host.

CpuUsed.description: The number of CPU cores used by the host.

HostClass.description: The instance type of the host.

InstanceNumberMaster.description: The number of primary instances deployed on the host.

InstanceNumberSlave.description: The number of secondary instances deployed on the host.

ExpiredTime.description: The expiration time of the host. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the **yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ** format. The time is displayed in UTC.

CPUAllocationRatio.description: The CPU overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster. Unit: %. The value is accurate to the tens digit.

ImageCategory.description:
The image of the host. This parameter is returned only when the database engine is **SQL Server**. Valid values:

*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntAlwaysonLicense**: SQL Server Cluster Edition (AlwaysOn).
*   **WindowsWithMssqlStdLicense**: SQL Server Standard Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntLicense**: SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlWebLicense**: SQL Server Web Edition.

DiskAllocationRatio.description: The storage overcommit ratio of the dedicated cluster.

HostMem.description: The memory size of the host. Unit: MB.

AccountName.description:
The account name of the host.

*   The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, and underscores (\_).
*   The name must start with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or a digit.
*   The name must be 2 to 16 characters in length.

DistributionTag.description: The distribution tag of the host.

400.errorMessage: The userid have no permission.

403.errorMessage: User not authorized to operate on the specified resource, or this API does not support RAM.
The user permission does not support the operation.

DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute.title: DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute
DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute.summary: Queries the parameter settings of a host in a dedicated cluster.

schema.description:
The database engine. Valid values:

*   **mysql**
*   **mssql**
*   **pgsql**
*   **redis**
The region ID. For more information, see [Region IDs](~~198326~~).
The zone ID.

The storage type. Valid values:

*   **local_ssd**: standard SSD.
*   **cloud_essd**: PL1 enhanced SSD (ESSD).
*   **cloud_essd2**: PL2 ESSD.
*   **cloud_essd3**: PL3 ESSD.

The image of the host. Valid values:

*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntAlwaysonLicense**: SQL Server Cluster Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlStdLicense**: SQL Server Standard Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlEntLicense**: SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
*   **WindowsWithMssqlWebLicense**: SQL Server Web Edition.
*   **AliLinux**: other images.

CddcHostType.description:
The category of the host. Valid values:

*   **general**: general-purpose.
*   **compute**: compute-optimized.
*   **ram**: memory-optimized.
*   **dragon**: ECS Bare Metal Instance.

NetBandWidth.description: The internal bandwidth of the host. Unit: Gbit/s.

EcsClass.description: The instance family of the host.

RdsClassCode.description: The instance type of the instance.

Cpu.description: The number of CPU cores of the host.

StorageIops.description: The storage IOPS of the host, which is displayed after being divided by 10,000.

EcsClassCode.description: The instance type of the host.

IsCloudDisk.description: Indicates whether the host uses cloud disks.

Memory.description: The memory size of the host. Unit: GB.

NetPackage.description: The packet forwarding rate over the internal network, which is displayed after being divided by 10,000. Unit: packets per second (PPS).

CpuVersion.description: The CPU model of the host.

400.errorMessage: The specified action is not valid.

403.errorMessage: You are not authorized to perform this action.
User not authorized to operate on the specified resource, or this API does not support RAM.

</DescribeHostEcsLevelInfoReponse>","errorExample":""}]
DescribeHostEcsLevelInfo.title: DescribeHostEcsLevelInfo
DescribeHostEcsLevelInfo.summary: Queries the information about host specifications.
DescribeHostEcsLevelInfo.description: After a host is created, you can call this operation to query the information about the host specifications, such as the CPU resources, memory resources, CPU model, host category, and storage type.

schema.description: The host ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.
The region ID of the host. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console to view the [region ID](~~198326~~).

Type.description:
The disk type of the enhanced SSD (ESSD) or local SSD. Valid values:

*   **system**: system disk.
*   **data**: data disk.

Status.description:
The state of the ESSD. Valid values:

*   **In_use**
*   **Available**
*   **Attaching**
*   **Detaching**
*   **Creating**
*   **ReIniting**

PerformanceLevel.description:
The performance level of the ESSD.

>  ApsaraDB for MyBase provides the following types of ESSDs: **ESSD**, **PL2 ESSD**, and **PL3 ESSD**. The higher performance level delivers better ESSD performance.

DiskId.description: The ID of the ESSD or local SSD.

MaxThroughput.description: The maximum throughput of the disk. Unit: MB/s.

MaxIOPS.description: The maximum IOPS of the disk, which is displayed after being divided by 10,000.

HasDBInstance.description:
Indicates whether the disk is attached to instances. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Device.description: The device name of the instance to which the ESSD or local SSD is attached.

Size.description: The size of the ESSD or local SSD. Unit: GB.

ZoneId.description: The zone ID of the ESSD or local SSD.

Category.description:
The storage type of the host. Valid values:

*   **cloud_ssd**: local SSD.
*   **cloud_essd**: ESSD.

DBInstanceId.description: The ID of the instance that uses the disk.

400.errorMessage: The user ID has no permission.

404.errorMessage: The specified host info is not found.
The specified DedicatedHostGroup does not exist.

DescribeDedicatedHostDisks.title: DescribeDedicatedHostDisks
DescribeDedicatedHostDisks.summary: Queries the information about disks on a host.

schema.description: The [region ID](~~198326~~) of the host.
The host ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.
The name of the host.

Indicates whether instances can be deployed on the host. Valid values:

*   **1**: yes.
*   **0**: no.

400.errorMessage: The userid have no permission.
The parameter's type error.

ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute.title: ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute
ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute.summary: Specifies whether instances can be deployed on a host in a dedicated cluster.

schema.description: The region ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the region ID.
The host ID. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHosts](~~200944~~) operation to query the host ID.

The switchover method of the primary instance. Valid values:

*   **MaintainTime** (default): The system performs a switchover within a maintenance window. The system switches workloads from the primary instance on the host to the secondary instance on another host, and then restarts the current host. This prevents service interruptions.
*   **Immediate**: The system immediately restarts the host.

DedicatedHostId.description: The ID of the host in the dedicated cluster.

ReplaceDedicatedHost.title: ReplaceDedicatedHost
ReplaceDedicatedHost.summary: Replaces a host in a dedicated cluster.
ReplaceDedicatedHost.description:
If you specify the manual host replacement policy when you create an ApsaraDB MyBase for MySQL dedicated cluster, you can call this operation to replace a **faulty** host in the dedicated cluster.

>  You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the value of the **HostStatus** parameter.

schema.description: [The region ID](~~198326~~) of the host.
The host ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.

The switchover method of the primary instance. Valid values:

*   **MaintainTime** (default): The system performs a switchover within a maintenance window. The system switches workloads from the primary instance on the host to the secondary instance on another host, and then restarts the current host. This prevents service interruptions.
*   **Immediate**: The system immediately restarts the host.

Specifies whether to forcefully restart the host. Valid values:

*   true: The system forcefully restarts the host. If this value is used, the system powers off the host. This results in the loss of cached data that is not written to storage. Exercise caution when you select this value.
*   false (default): The system restarts the host normally.

>  This parameter takes effect only for hosts that are created in ApsaraDB MyBase for Redis dedicated clusters of the Enhanced Edition (Tair). Hosts that are created in ApsaraDB MyBase dedicated clusters that run other database engines can be restarted normally.

400.errorMessage: The userid have no permission.

403.errorMessage: The host status does not support the operation.

RestartDedicatedHost.title: RestartDedicatedHost
RestartDedicatedHost.summary: Restarts a host in a dedicated cluster.

schema.description: The host ID. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHosts](~~200944~~) operation to query the host ID.
The region ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the region ID.
The zone ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the zone ID.

400.errorMessage: The user ID has no permission.

403.errorMessage: The instance does not support the operation.

404.errorMessage: The specified host info is not found.

DescribeHostWebShell.title: DescribeHostWebShell
DescribeHostWebShell.summary: Queries the URL of a webshell that is used to access a host.
DescribeHostWebShell.description: You can use a webshell to access a host in an ApsaraDB MyBase for MySQL or ApsaraDB MyBase for PostgreSQL dedicated cluster. For more information, see [Use a webshell to access a host](~~205456~~).

schema.description: The [region ID](~~198326~~).
The host ID. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Hosts** page to view the host ID.
The instance type to which you want the host to be upgraded. For more information, see [Host specification details](~~206343~~).

The time when you want to upgrade the specifications of the host. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time must be in UTC.

>  This parameter must be specified only when SwitchTimeMode is set to 2.

The execution mode that is used to upgrade host specifications. Valid values:

*   **0** (default): immediately upgrades host specifications.
*   **2**: upgrades host specifications at a specified point in time.

>  If you set this parameter to **2**, you must specify **SwitchTime**.

400.errorMessage: The specified action is not valid.

ModifyDedicatedHostClass.title: ModifyDedicatedHostClass
ModifyDedicatedHostClass.description:
After a host is created in a dedicated cluster, you can modify the specifications of the host based on your business requirements. The host specifications include the CPU and memory resources. For more information, see [Upgrade host specifications](~~262822~~).

>  When you upgrade the specifications of a host, the host restarts. The database instances that are running on the host also restart. For information about the impacts of a host restart, see [Restart a host](~~141772~~).

schema.description: The region ID of the host.
The ID of host N. You can specify multiple host IDs.

items.description:
The ID of host N. You can specify multiple host IDs. **N** specifies the serial number of the host. Examples:

*   **ResourceId.1** specifies the ID of the first host.
*   **ResourceId.2** specifies the ID of the second host.

schema.description: The tags.

Key.description:
The key of tag N.

*   **N** specifies the serial number of the tag. Examples:

    *   **Tag.1.Key** specifies the key of the first tag.
    *   **Tag.2.Key** specifies the key of the second tag.

*   If no tag key exists, a key is automatically created.

Value.description:
The value of tag N.

*   **N** specifies the serial number of the tag. Examples:

    *   **Tag.1.Value** specifies the value of the first tag.
    *   **Tag.2.Value** specifies the value of the second tag.

*   If no tag value exists, a value is automatically created.

schema.description: The resource type. Set the value to DEDICATEDHOST.

ListTagResources.summary: Queries the information about tags that are added to hosts.

schema.description: The region ID of the host.
The resource type. Set the value to DEDICATEDHOST.
The ID of host N. You can specify multiple host IDs.

items.description:
The ID of host N. You can specify multiple host IDs.

**N** specifies the serial number of the host. Examples:

*   **ResourceId.1** specifies the ID of the first host.
*   **ResourceId.2** specifies the ID of the second host.

schema.description: The tags.

Key.description:
The key of tag N.

*   **N** specifies the serial number of the tag. Examples:

    *   **Tag.1.Key** specifies the key of the first tag.
    *   **Tag.2.Key** specifies the key of the second tag.

*   You must specify one of this parameter and **ResourceId.N**.

Value.description:
The value of tag N.

*   **N** specifies the serial number of the tag. Examples:

    *   **Tag.1.Value** specifies the value of the first tag.
    *   **Tag.2.Value** specifies the value of the second tag.

*   If no tag value exists, a value is automatically created.

ResourceType.description:
The resource type.

ALIYUN::CDDC::DEDICATEDHOST is returned, which indicates an ApsaraDB for MyBase host.

schema.description: The host ID. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHosts](~~200944~~) operation to query the host ID.

The name of the host account.

*   The name must be 2 to 16 characters in length.
*   The name must start with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or a digit.
*   The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, and underscores (\_).

The password of the host account.

*   The password must be 6 to 32 characters in length.
*   The password must contain three of the following character types: upper letters, lower letters, digits, and special characters.
*   The password can contain the following special characters: `! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + - =`

>  If your host runs SQL Server, the password cannot contain the account name (case-insensitive).
The region ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the region ID.
The ID of the bastion host with which the host is associated. You can log on to the ApsaraDB for MyBase console and go to the **Bastion Hosts** page to view the bastion host ID.

The type of the host account. Valid values:

*   **Normal**: standard account.
*   **Admin**: administrator account.

For more information, see [Host permissions](~~176240~~).

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

400.errorMessage: The account password format is invalid.

403.errorMessage: The host status does not support the operation.

CreateDedicatedHostAccount.title: CreateDedicatedHostAccount
CreateDedicatedHostAccount.summary: Creates an account for a host.
CreateDedicatedHostAccount.description: Each host can have only one account. Before you create an account for a host, make sure that the existing account of the host is deleted. For more information, see [Create an account for a host](~~211413~~).

schema.description: The host ID. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHosts](~~200944~~) operation to query the host ID.

The name of the host account.

*   The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, and underscores (\_).
*   The name must start with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or a digit.
*   The name must be 2 to 16 characters in length.
The region ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the region ID.

404.errorMessage: Specified account name does not exist.

schema.description: The region ID of the host. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHostAttribute](~~213010~~) operation to query the region ID.

The new password.

*   The password must be 8 to 32 characters in length.
*   The password must contain at least three of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.
*   The password can contain the following special characters: `! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + - =`

>  If your dedicated cluster runs SQL Server, the password cannot contain the account name (case-insensitive).
The host ID. You can call the [DescribeDedicatedHosts](~~200944~~) operation to query the host ID.

404.errorMessage: The specified instance does not exist or is not supported.
